meanings.definition: A military unit typically consisting of two or more squads or sections.
meanings.sent1: The platoon marched in formation during the training exercise.
meanings.sent2: The platoon was responsible for securing the perimeter of the camp.
meanings.sent3: The platoon's synchronized marching looked like a well-choreographed dance.
meanings.sent4: The platoon moved like a single entity, each member knowing their role perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The platoon's discipline and unity were evident in their precise movements.

meanings.definition: A group of people working together on a particular task or project.
meanings.sent1: Our platoon worked tirelessly to complete the construction project.
meanings.sent2: The platoon of volunteers cleaned up the park in record time.
meanings.sent3: The platoon's teamwork was so efficient, they finished the task ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent4: Each member of the platoon contributed their unique skills to the group effort.
meanings.sent5: The platoon's collaboration resulted in a successful outcome for the project.
